data.message: So, if I understand correctly, this is ALREADY in place on FB and will be activated by FB should there be a disaster in my area. There is nothing for me to do regarding downloads or sign up.

replies.message: Hey Carol. If you are in the affected area, you will get a Facebook notification, see an alert at the top of your News Feed and receive an SMS from Facebook (if you have SMS enabled), asking if you are safe. Clicking on any of these messages will take you to Safety Check where you can mark yourself safe and check on others. In addition, you will see a bookmark on Facebook that takes you directly to the Safety Check. You may also search for Safety Check through the Facebook search bar. -Hailey

You are on Facebook so because Facebook has created this, you automatically have it. If something happens in your area, everyone who has Facebook and an Internet connection will be able to click that they are safe in your area because they will send you a message on both your phone and text.
